poem:
Title: Of Idol's Breast Yet Broken Hearts

In Verona's square, a silence cut,
Steel hand on Juliet, reckless rut –
Touristed touch makes a parody of trust.
A bronze bosom with an unsought thrust,
Yet marks the hollow in we humans, unjust.
She, ensnared by love's immortal thrust,
Now punctured like an old-world bust.
How curious, our hunger for star-crossed dust.
